newsitem.title: USA: Garden Ridge delays Ga. store expansion.
newsitem.headline: Garden Ridge delays Ga. store expansion.

text.p: Garden Ridge Corp said Friday it will open only one store in the third quarter instead of two as originally planned due to weather and site development delays in Atlanta.
Due to the delay, Garden Ridge said it will open a total of three stores instead of four during 1997.

"We are disappointed that weather and site development delays in Atlanta have prevented the completion of our third Atlanta store in time to ensure a fall opening. Due to the seasonal nature of our business it is not prudent to open a store in the fourth quarter," said Armand Shapiro, Garden Ridge's chairman and chief executive officer.
The Atlanta store will now open in the first quarter in 1998. The company plans to open a total of six stores in 1998.
Shares of Garden Ridge lost 1-1/8 to 11-3/8 in midday trading.
